bulletPoints.header: There are 4 main Display types in HTML and CSS

bulletPoints.content:
The block display type takes up the entire width of the page.
 It forces a new line above and below it.
 The height and width of block elements can be defined but the width will be set to 100% by default.
 Divs are blocks by default.

The elements that are defined by inline type are scalable and only takes up space that is required by itâ€™s contents.
 You can have multiple inline elements in the same line.
 They cannot be resized as they only take up essential space.
 Spans are inline by default.

Here, the elements are shown to take up only the space required by the contents but in reality take up the entire line by default.
 A good Example are Images. They can be resized but they still take up the entire width like blocks by default.

This type removes the element from the visible display of the screen.
 It can be used to hide elements temporarily
